channel.title: Minnesota AG Press Releases
channel.description: Latest press releases from the Minnesota Attorney General's Office

item.title: Attorney General Ellison charges one with $7.3M in Medicaid fraud prosecution
item.description:
Former felon Chavis Willis charged with racketeering, felony theft by swindle; was not eligible to operate Medicaid-funded business, billed for services not rendered

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2025/01/08_Willis.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison reaches settlement with immigration charity to address governance deficiencies
item.description:

item.title: Attorney General Ellison sues Deere & Company to protect farmers from high repair costs and unfair corporate tactics
item.description:

Including Chappy’s case, AG’s office charges total 21 people with $3M in Medicaid fraud this week

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/09/27_MedicaidFraud.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison, Commissioner Lucero choose to fight LGBTQ wedding-video discrimination case in trial court
item.description:
Instead of appealing split Eighth Circuit decision, will take case back to federal district court to build record of actual facts to counter plaintiff’s ‘fairy tale’ assertions

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/10/02_TelescopeMedia.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison asks court to deny Purdue’s and Sacklers’ move to avoid accountability for death and destruction
item.description:
Joins 24 other AGs in bankruptcy-court filing against Purdue’s motion to halt lawsuit; Ellison’s office plays leading role in drafting oppositions

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/10/04_PurduePharma.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison defends women’s access to full range of reproductive healthcare
item.description:
Joins 19 other AGs in filing amicus brief at 5th Circuit in support of women’s health clinic challenging Mississippi’s near-total ban on abortion

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/10/07_MississippiClinic.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison files suit to halt North Minneapolis landlord’s ‘eviction for profit’ scheme, obtains court order protecting his tenants who want to contact city housing inspectors
item.description:
In response to AG’s lawsuit, Hennepin County Court stops Steven Meldahl from enforcing illegal lease provisions, freezes bank accounts. Meldahl, who evicts 99 percent of tenants, has been cited more than 1,300 times in last 10 years for City housing-code violations

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/10/08_MinneapolisLandlord.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison seeks more federal help for students unfairly harmed by closure of Argosy University and Art Institues
item.description:
Co-leads letter of 30 AGs to ask Secretary DeVos to expand ‘closed school discharge’ to more students of schools closed after owner’s misconduct and mismanagement

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/10/17_Helpforstudents.asp

item.title: Attorney General’s Office wins next step in case against landlord Steven Meldahl
item.description:
Court issues temporary injunction that expands scope of earlier order to require that Meldahl get properties inspected, inform tenants of rights to inspection, and stop charging more than 8 percent for late fees. Meldahl, who brags about evicting 99 percent of his tenants, has been cited more than 1,300 times in last 10 years for City housing-code violations.

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/10/17_Meldahl.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison joins lawsuit protecting Endangered Species Act
item.description:
Ellison: Trump Administration’s undermining of the Act ‘is not only unlawful, it’s un-Minnesotan’ ESA currently protects the Topeka Shiner, Canada Lynx, and Prairie Fringed Orchid, among other Minnesota species

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/10/22_EndageredSpeciesAct.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison sues companies and individuals running fraudulent student loan debt “forgiveness” scheme, obtains court order immediately halting conduct
item.description:
Companies illegally charged up-front fees upwards of $1,300 for filling out and submitting forms to the federal government for loan repayment and consolidation programs, which eligible borrowers can apply for on their own for free. In response to lawsuit, federal judge issues temporary restraining order against defendants

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/10/30_StudentLoanCompanies.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison’s office notches big victory for defrauded MSB/Globe students
item.description:
Minnesota Supreme Court allows AG’s office to obtain tuition refunds for more than 1,300 low-income students of MSB/Globe criminal-justice program — more than $33 million in restitution now possible. Court also affirms AG’s authority to seek restitution for all Minnesotans harmed by fraud.

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/11/06_MSBGlobe.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison and coalition win fight to stop Trump Administration healthcare discrimination rule
item.description:
Federal court issues summary judgment vacating entire HHS rule ‘refusal of care’ rule. Rule would have drastically expanded healthcare providers’ ability to deny necessary healthcare to virtually anyone they chose, solely on the basis of their own ‘religious beliefs or moral convictions’

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/11/06_RefusalOfCare.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison fights unlawful attempt to use healthcare coverage to bar immigrants
item.description:
Joins coalition of 22 AGs in challenging presidential proclamation that would bar entry to immigrants who do not possess certain health insurance or the ability to pay for medical care

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/11/13_DoeVTrump.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison leads fight to classify non-compete clauses as unfair and illegal
item.description:
Abusive non-compete clauses currently prevent 30 million Americans — especially low-income ones — from getting better jobs, pursuing higher ambitions, and leaving hostile or unsafe work environments

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/11/18_NonCompeteClauses.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison reaches agreement to help school districts afford the price of school milk
item.description:
Will protect more than 40 school districts and programs through 2030

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/11/19_DFA.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison once again leads fight to protect Liberians from deportation
item.description:
Co-leads coalition of 14 states in supporting appeal of dismissal of lawsuit against Trump Administration order to end DED protections.Third time this year that AG Ellison moves to protect Liberians against President’s attempt to terminate status.

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/11/26_ACTvTrump.asp

item.title: State sues JUUL for deceptive marketing targeting youth
item.description:
AG Ellison announces lawsuit with Gov. Walz as Minnesota loses 10 years of progress in fighting youth tobacco use. JUUL addicts youth by deceiving them about nicotine content, following Big Tobacco marketing playbook.

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/12/04_JUUL.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison bans Texas company over sale of suspect ‘extended warranties’ for vehicles
item.description:
Settlement also requires AutoAssure, LLC to pay $400K toward refunds for around 1,000 Minnesota consumers

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/12/12_AutoAssure.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison defends refugees against President’s unlawful executive order
item.description:
Joins coalition of 12 AGs in brief in support of refugee-resettlement organizations challenging Trump order; argues order violates federal law, interferes with state sovereignty, and undermines family reunification. Brief filed on same day Gov. Walz announces Minnesota will continue to accept refugees.

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/12/13_RefugeeResettlement.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison files suit against president of Journey Home Minnesota
item.description:
Lawsuit alleges Blake Huffman mismanaged JHM’s charitable assets, engaged in transactions with clear conflicts of interest, abandoned JHM’s charitable mission

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/12/16_JourneyHomeMinnesota.asp

item.title: Attorney General Ellison permanently bans two charities that deceived Minnesotans about supporting families of fallen police officers
item.description:
Obtains settlement that permanently bans two related charities from soliciting in Minnesota, requires one of them to pay back nearly $300K solicited from Minnesotans

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2019/12/20_PoliceCharityBan.asp

item.title: Attorney General’s Working Group on Sexual Assault Releases Report and Recommendations
item.description:
No description available.

https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2018/12/SexualAssaultTaskForceReport.pdf
